intro: Catanthera endertii, commonly known as the Endert's catanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters, often displaying shades of pink or white. Catanthera endertii is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats, showcasing a compact growth form. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies on plant adaptations in arid environments.
